headline: Jay's Signature Pizza Crust
description: This thick crust pizza dough recipe uses simple ingredients to make a chewy, soft crust with a crispy exterior, perfect for your favorite toppings.

video.description: You’re going to love this 5-star recipe for homemade pizza crust.
video.name: Jay’s Signature Pizza Crust

name: Jay's Signature Pizza Crust
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together warm water, yeast, and brown sugar in a large mixing bowl; let sit for 10 minutes.

Stir oil and salt into yeast mixture. Mix in 2 1/2 cups flour until incorporated. Turn dough out onto a clean, floured surface. Knead dough, adding remaining flour, a little at a time, until dough is no longer sticky. Place dough into an oiled bowl.
Cover with a towel and let rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down dough and form it into a tight ball. Allow dough to relax for 1 minute before rolling out.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
If baking dough on a pizza stone, place toppings on dough and bake immediately. If baking dough on a pan, lightly oil the pan and let dough rise for 15 to 20 minutes before topping and baking it.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I have been making this pizza crust for years. Sometimes I add some herbs to the crust, but it is a good stand alone crust as well. Everyone that I have made pizza for have loved it, even the children at the childcare center where I work at and many parties nd for home. If I could give it more than 5 stars I would! All I can say is it stands up to as many toppings as you want. It also freezes well. I usually make a single batch for home, divide it in half and freeze one ball of dough. Later I will pull. It out of the freezer, let it thaw, and use a little flour to roll it out on. It will make two large crusts that are not too thin or too thick, they are just right! Just know that you an roll them out pretty thin, they will rise in baking.
easy and yummy, this is our go to recipe for pizza crust!

This has been my go-to homemade pizza dough recipe for 10 years now. It is a little time consuming having to wait for it to rise, but easy to make. I've also used bread flour for a chewier crust. It beats out the just add water dough mixes and premade doughs. It's easily customizable so you can add spices, honey, etc to add flavor if this is too bland. This makes enough for 2- 12" pizzas
Very good, nice and puffy. Taste is great! sometimes I use bread flour. Comes out a little chewier.

This pizza crust was just ok. Definitely not a 5 star pizza crust. No, it doesn't taste like the Pizza Hut crust. I followed the recipe exactly and it kinda tasted like cardboard crust. It makes a lot of dough. I got enough for 2 large pizzas. Will use the other half of the dough for breadsticks but not pizza. Won't be making this again.
My go-to pizza dough.

We loved this recipe, but did make just a few changes to the dough. I bought Neapolitan Pizza Seasoning by McCormick at our grocery store. I added 1 1/2 teaspoon of this in with the oil which was added to the yeast. I added 4 1/3 cups of flour to the yeast to mix in my Kitchen Aid mixer and mixed for 2 minutes pushing down dough if needed. Then I mixed it on speed 2 for 5 minutes to complete the kneeding. I added 1/3 to 1/2 cup of flour to my counter and continue kneeding the dough with my hands for another few minutes until it was just slightly sticky. Then I set it in an oiled bowl to rise. Best crust ever!

Love this recipe!! Have not been able to buy frozen or restaurant pizza since discovering it. I tend to use a little extra brown sugar, 1tsp or so, because I like a good thick crust and only have a toaster oven for cooking.
This has been my go-to pizza crust recipe since 2007. The only thing I do differently is I use mozzarella string cheese sticks to make it stuffed crust.
I loved the texture of this crust. A little crispy on the outside and very soft on the inside. I will definitely use this recipe from now on.
Fool proof recipe!! Works every time!!
Very good pizza crust.
I added some spices, garlic and onion powder and a bit of Italian seasoning to the dough when I was making it.

I love this recipe. I think I've been using this recipe upwards of 20 yrs. In the area of PA I'm in they seriously lack good pizza and those that were good went on the cheap during the pandemic. Thanks to Jay I can make pizza upwards as good as I used to get in NYC. To make it so easy I use the dough cycle of my bread machine and it comes out awesome. I play with what I put in the dough from fresh garlic to honey to a variety of spices. I generally use bread flour and milk instead of water. Next time I'm going to try it with half bread flour and half sprouted whole grain flour. 

Try this recipe, you'll love it..and don't be afraid to play with it. It's a very flexible basic recipe.

The thing that holds pizza back from being as good as a good NYC pizzeria is it's impossible to buy the best mozzarella, name brand Grande, retail. No fault of the crust on this.

So this is a fantastic recipe! I actually let it rise twice because I had extra time. Then I split it in two and made two pizzas. I used pans so they got to rise for about 15min before topping. I brushed the crust with some olive oil and garlic too. Baked as recommended and the pizza was absolutely FANTASTIC! Highly recommend this recipe
Best pizza dough ever. I make it exactly as the recipe and use it for thick or thin crust. It’s amazing either way!! Love love it! It’s my go to pizza dough for Friday pizza night!
Great
amazing crust I was able to make a stuffed crust with it and it turned out just amazing. thank you for this recipe

Very easy crust. It is kind of bland. I read reviews and added extra sugar, garlic and onion powder, basil and parmesan. Next time I will amp up the spices more. Unique texture, not my favorite, but very easy.
Added 1 1/2tsp rosemary and brushed the crust with oil. Tried lots of pizza doughs and this one tops them so far.

Tasted very close to Pizza Hut Pan Pizza. The best dough recipe I’ve found so far. The only improvement I’d like to add next time is maybe try adding some garlic butter to the crust ring and maybe on my pan so that it’ll have that crispy buttery yum like Pizza Hut but otherwise it was exactly like Pizza Hut. 
Extremely easy to make, taste is wonderful: baked my on convection at 425 and it was perfect

I doubled the recipe to freeze half for later. The first half, I ended up refrigerating for about 24 hours wrapped in plastic wrap and in a gallon sized ziplock bag. The dough expanded a bit outside of the plastic wrap but the ziplock bag kept it contained, and had a yeasty/beer-like smell - apparently is totally normal. Next time I will split regular quantity of dough in half to make 2 smaller, flatter pizzas and pre-bake the crust to get it browner.
It was okay not so chewy as I like. I never made pizza. I added about 1/2 cup more of flour cuz it was very sticky. That might have been the problem.
It was chewy, soft but also crunchy. Need to prebake if you dont have a pizza stone.
Not good for someone who as never made a pizza thankfully I have.
Excellent crust. Followed directions exactly as written. This is now my go to crust.

GREAT CRUST, I split it into two, and froze one for later. Crust is beautiful. I made bacon cheeseburger Pizza, with pizza sauce I canned in the fall, simply short of amazing !!! I will definitely use this recipe over and over again :)

Followed the recipe precisely.. You can judge the results.. Very tasty. I divided the dough and froze the remaining dough ball. (Put the ball in a bowl, oiled with cooking spray, and wrapped with cellophane to keep it from drying out.) I placed it in the microwave to come to room temp and rest/2nd rise till dinner time.. Just a tasty 4 days later as on day one. Thanks Jay!

Omg, I have never made homemade pizza that tasted this yummy, this dough puts any other pizza place to shame, we don’t have a pizza stone so we used pans, it’s a must to bake it 10 min before you add the toppings. Thanks for the share and I don’t think I’ll be ordering much pizza like I use to
Delicious! Easy to make and is enough to make a large pizza or two medium ones depending on crust thickness.
My favorite homemade pizza crust yet!

What a great crust, and super easy! I made it exactly the way it was written. I ended up doubling it, because my family of five eats a TON of pizza, so a single recipe was hardly enough. The dough kneaded well, the flour was the exact amount required for elasticity, and the flavor was excellent. Five stars.
Not only was the crust itself great, the instructions were excellent. I like that it made a nice big crust.
Easy recipe as is. No need to modify anything. Always a family favorite. We did split the dough and made 2 medium pizzas. If you are looking for a full proof pizza crust, look no further!
This recipe has reasonable proportions for a medium-sized pizza crust. I did not add olive oil and used a mix of honey and brown sugar.
I absolutely love this crust recipe! The only thing I suggest for first timers is to split your dough into two pizzas— I know it won’t look like a lot but trust me, the dough rises so much.
This is the best homemade pizza crust I’ve ever made! Thank you for the recipe!
Great recipe! simple and delicious!
Good
excellent recipe, however I used the fancy Italian flour (Caputo's) from Wegmans and that made it MOST excellent !!!

Flavor of crust was quite good but directions are a bit confusing. I ended up adding 2+ additional cups of flour one I started kneading the dough. This would have been helpful to know as I almost threw the dough away as I thought there may have been too much flour.

READ THE FULL RECIPE BEFORE MAKING!!!!!

It is a great recipe, but it calls for 3 1/3 cups of flour and you ONLY use 2 1/2 cups in the recipe itself. There’s no way you will use an almost full extra cup kneading it. IF it takes 3 1/3 cups in the recipe it needs to include it not separate it. Kneading does take extra flour so it needs to be much more clear.
Made this in my bread machine. Definitely needed more flour. I ended up kneading in another 1/2c of flour. But, after that, it baked up well.
Needed more flour than the recipe suggested.
Just add 2 taps of brown sugar and it’s perfect, crispy and fluffy at the same time!
Great recipe, crunchy outside, chewy inside, really good flavor, perfect for grilled pizza!
Just okay. Will probably create two crusts if I use this recipe again.

So easy and very good. It is a lot of dough. I use a large pizza stone and a small stone. I pat the dough out onto parchment paper, let rise before adding toppings. It’s easy to slide a cookie sheet under the pizza to transfer it to the hot pizza stones. As another reviewer suggested it’s best to cook it on a lower rack to avoid burning the toppings. We use sun dried tomatoe pesto instead of pizza sauce and it makes a flavorful pizza.
I've tried a number of pizza crust recipes and this one was very good.
All I can say, THIS IS THE BEST!!!
This was fantastic!! Crusty on the outside and chewy on the inside. Frankly one of the best Pizzas I have ever eaten!!!
I've made this recipe three times now, and its amazing every time! It takes forever to make, but I'd say it's worth it!
Delicious! A great recipe, I let the dough rise for 3-4 hours for a fluffy texture. My dough was sticky while kneading so I had to add more flour. but overall the recipe is fantastic, thanks Jay!

This is the second time I made it. This time I included a half cup of whole wheat flour. It still rose and cooked nicely. Since the recipe is large enough for 2 12 inch pizzas, I took half and made dinner rolls which came out great for dipping in spaghetti sauce (buttered). This is a versatile recipe.
If you make it right, it turns out great. Pretty darn simple to make too.
This is the best tasting pizza crust I've found. I used my Kitchen Aid mixer and used about 3 1/2 cups (maybe a little more) flour.
A really nice & light, yet crusty pizza crust.
The 1st time I made it, it was perfect. the next 3 times it wouldn't rise. I don't know what I am doing wrong. otherwise it tastes great.
Noe here is a simple but straight forward recipe fool proof no matter how you put it together great tasting crust too
Found it 'bready' and not with a crispy bottom like we were hoping. We did have a stone baking pan but either didn't let it pre-bake long enough or the dough should have been thinner
Love it! So easy and always a hit
This was excellent. I used a stand mixer and just kneaded a bit after it was mixed.
I made it without any modifications. The crust was soft with a little crunch. It was great - my family loved it. It was so easy to make, we're thinking of having pizza day weekly!
Made this exactly like the recipe said. It browned very well and was very tasty. I used a 16" pan and this was the right amount of dough. I will be making this again.
"There is nothing I didn't like about it but i've had better" - my gma
Have made this many times with every topping imaginable. Makes two big pizzas. A crispy and chewy hand tossed style crust. A very reliable dough.

FIRST TIME PIZZA MAKER: This was my first time making a pizza crust, and im glad i went with this recipe.
THE DOUGH MIX:
 I took the advice of other reviewers and added some garlic + onion powder ( about a tablespoon of each) and half cup Parmesan cheese to the oil mixture. When you're kneading the dough, the garlic and onion will be very fragrant, but not to worry--- when your pizza comes out, you may wish you had put more b/c your crust will just be flavorful and not super-duper garlic-y. 
PIZZA PANS: 
I used 2 regular/rectangular, large aluminum baking pans to put my pizzas in. I oiled the pans and generously "floured" them with Semolina flour(a substitute-- i didnt have any cornmeal-- you can google other substitutes). maybe will seem unnecessary to you, but help with texture of crust/evenness of baking the pizza. 
BAKING TIME:
after pressing the dough into the oiled/ semolina floured pans, I prebaked my dough for about 8 mins and then took then out to throw regular Marinara sauce on top, a little bit of jack cheese, clumps of fresh mozzarella, mushrooms, sausage. I baked for a longer time than the directions said... about 40 mins total. the center seems more crispy on outside and soft on inside throughout when i baked for longer. 
MARINARA, LESS IS MORE:
Like some websites mentioned, i totally agree that even though you want to put more tomato sauce on the pizza... DONT. That will make it very soggy-- i took this advice and totally great pizza.
This is hands down, the best pizza crust recipe.

Delish! And easy!! This is the second time I've made it and it's fantastic. This time I topped the crust with a little garlic and oregano before adding sauce, mozzarella, and traditional toppings. Yum!

I made this crust more than once, and I realized it turns best by adding all the 3 cups of flour at once instead the 2 and something before kneading (first time I made it like that, it was a mess). In that sense, I decided to follow my gut and do it my way. I cooked it in the oven before adding the toppings.
Perfect
This recipe makes the perfect pizza dough! I use this everytime with various different toppings.

Super easy and great tasting! We have made the recipe exactly as listed and also made small flavoring adjustments, like adding garlic powder and Italian seasoning for breadsticks. This recipe is a keeper!
Just the perfect consistency for a little thicker hand tossed type pizza! Love it!!
Perfect! I do use this to make two pizzas. One I make a deep dish in the 12” cast iron 350 for 20-30 mins. The other is a 16” thin crust 450 on parchment paper.
This was one of the top pizza crusts I ever made and will be my go to from now on.
It's very good. Only thing I had to add so much more flour than called for (almost a whole cup more), as the dough was too sticky without it.

I've made this recipe a couple times, pretty standard pizza dough. I add about half a tsp of baking powder for extra fluffiness. I also add quite a bit more salt than the recipe calls for, I've been burned too many times by bland dough. I also set the oven to 450 instead of 425 for about 10 minutes depending on the size/thickness of dough and toppings on pizza. This dough rises nicely so I usually roll it out on the thinner side and make 2 pizzas out of the recipe. I also like to brush melted butter on the crust before baking for some more flavour and colour. I remove pizza from pan almost as soon as pizza is finished cooking (bottom is usually golden perfection) and place on cooking racks so it doesnt get soggy.
This crust recipe is exactly what we were looking for. Chewy but crusty with perfect pizza crust taste!

I make pizza a lot. This was a great recipe that I used as stated for two large pizza pans (the ones with holes). I pre-baked in a preheated oven at 475 for 7 to 8 minutes. Then, put all the fixings on and baked at the same temperature for 12 to 15 minutes. Perfect! I did also use olive on on my pans and liberally scattered cornmeal on the pans before placing the dough on. I will definitely use this recipe again as it was crusty on the bottom and perfect on the inside.

This recipe makes a great crust! I followed the directions as written and rolled out two pizza stone size pizza crusts. I used the Exquisite Pizza Sauce from this site, and layered on some of our favorite toppings The crust was crisp on the outside, tender on the inside. It was so easy, it's a great quarantine recipe!
Fantastic! Used half self rising and half whole wheat flour since that was what I had on hand. Sprinkled the pizza peel with corn meal as that creates a nice addition to the bottom of the crust.

We couldn't find a recipe that allowed us to make the pizza within the next few hours...until...
This was an excellent recipe! My kids had so much fun making it. During the COVID-19 safer at home time, it is nice to have the kids make meals from scratch. Thanks so much for this recipe!
I’m a long time baker and this recipe turns out great every time! Pizza stones make a big difference, but if you’ve been baking for a while and know the basics this recipe is perfect.

This recipe made pizza making so easy. I will make more pizzas when I get more flour, which the stores are out of right now due to the Corona Virus. There is actually no bread in the stores either so it was innovative when I was able to make my own pizza bread. I substituted straight flour for 1/3 part tortilla mix in the bag and whole wheat flour. It turned out good. Also, I added 3 tbs. of brown sugar instead of the called for 1 tbs. This dish was delish and made making my first pizza easy, plus, there wasn't any weight gain like if I had gone to a commercial pizza place. I added so many vegetables on top that it was like a deep dish pizza pie. Thank you All recipes for the recipe!!
I came out wonderful. Made a deep dish parmesan pizza with this dough. I bakes it for 10 min before I put the ingredients in.

I will definitely make this again. We liked the crunch of the crust and it held toppings well. I did bake the dough for 15 minutes before putting toppings on and the crust and toppings were perfectly baked.

Thank you for the great crust recipe. I made this into 2 thin crust sheet pizzas I followed some of the recommendations such as adding seasonings to the dough and prebaking the oiled crust for 7 minutes. The family loved it!

I made it with no changes. 
I've made it 3 times and it has been great! My husband loves it and it is easy to make!
Turned out great! Next time, I would use less than on full recipe in an 11x18 pan, because we like thinner crust. The consistency was almost perfect otherwise, and the family really liked it.
Great recipe, prebake a little
Amazing, each and every time we've made it! No alterations, just an easy recipe!
Everyone loves this pizza crust!! It’s my go to for making pizza now!! Thank you for the awesome recipe!!!
I will make it again definitely.
The only one I use now. It works for any thickness you like. We like to make a big crust ring to eat with honey for dessert! Thanks Jay

Best all purpose dough ever! I’ve made this dough at least 50 times. Always my go to! Depending on what I’m making, I’ll add different herbs or cheese to the dough depending on what I’m using it for. I’ve made pizza, calzones, breadsticks, fruit pies, pot pies, and more with it. I’m making cheese stuffed bread sticks tonight for dinner, and realized I’ve never rated this recipe. Try it!
Amazing!!!
Always turns out so perfect! Great tasting & easy to make

This was easy to make and so tasty. I used half of the dough for a medium pizza and the other half I stored in the fridge and made into cinnamon rolls. My husband couldn’t get enough of either one. I will definitively make again.
